primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His salvation through a suffering and lonely Servant, while humanity fails to recognize or accept Him due to worldly standards of power.

tekstueel_bewijs: forging his way, edging his way toward the supreme loneliness
to set things right spiritually as between people and their God
Jehovah's love, with its austere holiness and integrity
to make all of the difference to all of the future

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied as the one revealing the 'arm of the Lord')
tekstueel_bewijs: To whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?
dazzled by prominence, bigness, worldly power
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a habit but a fundamental 'reading of life' that prevents seeing God's revelation.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to the Servant's invitation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer is invited to respond to the primary program of Christ's loneliness.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → The Servant ← Worldly Power/Blindness

voorbeelden_god_subject: God works and how God shows himself
The Lord saw in his wisdom and grace
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we hid as it were our faces from him
we insist on worshiping the gods we have made
Have I rejected and deserted the blessed Savior?

voorbeelden: The Son of man must suffer
we want to bring our tests
I will not demand of God
wanting desperately to make someone understand
we are not conditioned... to see
he knows what it is like
how else would he ever know how to reach our complaint

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the conflict of desires—the world's desire for power vs. God's desire for the Servant's path.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false security of S2 (Worldly power) to the painful reality of ~S1 (Rejection), finally resolving in S1 (The Lonely Lord as Intercessor).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ occupying the position of ultimate loneliness to become the Intercessor.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; worldly power is described as a 'skin game' and a 'dupe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there are moral appeals, the engine of the sermon is the objective work of Christ as the 'Lonely Lord' who acts on behalf of the incompetent hearer.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I will put myself at God's disposal and see how it all comes out.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Intercession
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus prays for you... the great intercessor never ceases.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Servant is not presented as a model to imitate, but as a Savior whose unique path provides a benefit the hearer cannot achieve.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort in loneliness; relief from the pressure of worldly success.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is based on Christ's identification with human misery.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the Isaiah text with the New Testament reality of Christ.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'trying to make the world better' and 'human ways will never make the world what it ought to be'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: It was the only way he could get under all of the weary pain of lonely people.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on Christ's intercession than the Spirit's indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'blindness' and 'selfishness' rather than a cosmic death-grip.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative successfully places Christ as the Subject of the primary saving action (Intercession/Suffering).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer is occasionally pressured to 'not demand of God' (Subject role).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that even our 'surrender' is a gift from the Intercessor.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: High Devoir (Must) in the middle section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how Christ's loneliness gives us the *power* to face our own.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's loneliness) correctly grounds the Ethics (Discipleship).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound theocentric sermon that avoids the trap of making Christ a mere example, instead presenting Him as the unique Subject of our salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of loneliness; Greimas shows that loneliness is a functional necessity for the Subject to reach the Object.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would debate the identity of the Servant; semiotics focuses on the Servant's role in the narrative economy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'loneliness' is not just a feeling but a modal competence (Savoir-faire) that allows the Subject to reach the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'loneliness' as the primary actantial obstacle that the Subject must overcome to achieve the Object.
